resources.string: SSRA
Ship Safety Risk Assessment

Blasting is the process of treating a surface by propelling particles at high velocity toward it. It is a quick and easy way to remove foreign matter from metal, rubber or plastic. Blasting is generally performed in enclosed environments like blasting chambers or cabinets, or on open sites, for example on buildings, bridges, tanks, boats or mobile plants. Common hazards include dust, hazardous chemicals, and risks associated with the use of plant and equipment. \n Blasting has many variants, including:
Lifting and shifting materials for blasting

It is a machine for cleaning structure steel. It strongly blasts the original condition steel parts to remove surface rust, welding slag, and scale, making it show uniform metal color and improve coating quality and corrosion prevention effect

Abrasive blasting is the operation of forcibly propelling a stream of abrasive material against a surface under high pressure to smooth a rough surface, roughen a smooth surface, shape a surface or remove surface contaminants.

Using defective blasting pots and air hoses

`Ensure that hoses are arrange in proper manner
Insert wires or safety pins between couplers

Fatal

Use only 110DC power supply in confined

use of heavy sucking machine

Use blasting hood with air supplied

Hydro blasting is a technique for cleaning internal and external surfaces, which relies entirely on the sheer force of water from a pressurized source to achieve the desired 18 cleaning effect on the intended surface.
Entry in confined space for setting up of hoses and equipment
Setting up of the hydro blasting machine and hose / equipment
Presence of toxic/flammable gases
Insufficient oxygen
Obstruction to access/ egress
Asphyxiation
Minor injuries
Supply Forced ventillation
maintain good housekeeping
proper cable and hoses management
Connections not secured properly
Loud noise from the hydro blasting operation
Long exposure to hand/arm vibration
Struck by high pressure water jet
Struck by high pressure water jet due to swinging of the hoses
Vibration white finger/ dead finger
observe safe working pratice for working at height
ensure thatscaffold used is validated if required to use
ear plug to be worn during hydro blasting
conduct hearing test for blasters
limit individual blaster working duration
use face shield and all other necessary PPE
do not expose body limbs/ parts to the high pressure jet during blasting
check and secure all connection
blaster to use quick release catch
ensure more than adequate length of hose is pull in the working area
Fall into the water
Body ache due to shoveling of rubbish such as paint flakes, rust, scales
Drowning
Body ache
ensure that water is pump out before attempting to carry out cleaning
use proper body posture when handling shovel
Trip and fall
ensure that hose/cable and equipment is not placed obstructing passageaway

Grit blasting is a process where high-speed abrasive particles are accelerated and forcefully directed against a surface to remove contaminants from the surface and condition the surface for subsequent finishing
Transporting and unload blasting equipment to worksite
Physical hazards
Improper lifting
Unauthorized operator for lifting operation
Falling object due to defective/ improper lifting gears used (lifting ires, belts and shackles)
lifters likely to suffer bodily injury
Use lifting gears appropriate to the load carried
Do visual inspection ensure that intended lifting gears are in good working condition
Use lifting gers which are inspected annually and endosred with a valid certificate
keep unauthorized personnel away from lifting area
Identify and keep away from areas whereby hazard of strucking by equipment, pinch points is high
Check and ensure that intended personnel are qualified and trained to perform the lifiting

Using defective blasting equipment
Use cable hangar to hang up hoses and cables

Regarding paint performance, it is generally said that insufficient surface treatment is the cause of more than 50 percent of the paint failures experienced. In general, painting has two functions. One is to protect the steel surface from corrosion, and the other is to give a good cosmetic appearance. In shipbuilding, special attention is paid to the paint\'s anti-corrosive capability, because it affects the ship\'s life and service performance Surface preparation consists of two stages; the primary and secondary.The primary preparation is shot blasting, sandblasting and grit blasting. Mechanical surface preparation devices powered by compressed air are controlled by a single operator. These mechanical dusting tools are the most widely used in secondary surface preparation. Power tools such as a power brush, disc sander, etc., are mainly applied in secondary preparation.
Slip , trip and fall
Improper connection leading to flying object
Check and ensure proper connection and PPE
Flying particles into eye
Cut by high speed rotating disc or cup brushes
Wear safety googles and face shield
Obstruction of access/egress causing trip and fall
Defective spray pump , hoses and joints
Spray pump and temporary paint storage not cordon off
Ensure that hoses are arrange in proper manner and escape route free from obstruction
check before use for visible cracks, worn out , dents, hoses and joints condition
Exclusion of spray pump and paint storage area by barricading and signage
Injuries caused by high pressure fluid
Fires and explosion
Exposure and contact with paint dusts/solvent
Ensure spray hose does not kink at all times
Check joints and ensure proper tightening
Pump man standby and alert to shut off when required
co ordinate in VSCC meeting
application and approval of painting permit
earthing of spray pump
check before use of explosion proof lights and cable
Observe precaution and steps to be taken as stated in MSDS
examine spray pump, ventilation blower, de-humidifier, compressors reguraly
yearly hearing test for painters
Fall from height
Exposure to open paint and thinner cans
Spray pump topple
Obstruction of access causing trip and fall

During spray painting operations, workers are at a greater risk of exposure to hazardous substances than when they are painting with a brush or roller. Paint particles are released into the atmosphere through the spray nozzle, which increases the release of hazardous vapors. While safer methods have been developed, such as using less volatile and less toxic paints and coatings, and low-flow airless spray nozzles, shipyard employers still need to take precautions to avoid hazardous exposures to workers
Ship repair coating and painting of the hull block erection butt, seam joints and edges are also defined as a “touch up method”

A forklift (also called lift truck, jitney, fork truck, fork hoist, and forklift truck) is a powered industrial truck used to lift and move materials over short distances. Forklifts are rated for loads at a specified maximum weight and a specified forward center of gravity
Adjust forks to desired width
Pinch points
Over exertion
Ensure that lock pins are in placed
Struck onto object / people
load falling off forks
Overloading
Turnbehind to check blind spots before driving off
Improper condition
Lock out and tag out system
Only qualified electrician to be assigned on the job
Fatal Injury

A cherry picker is a hydraulic crane with a raised platform at the end for raising and lowering people. Cherry Picker is a movable vertical boom with an open bucket at the end from which a worker can perform aerial work.
A ballast tank is a compartment within a boat, ship or other floating structure that holds water, which is used as ballast to provide stability for a vessel.
